H0.text: Ocean acidification is what occurs when excess carbon dioxide in the atmosphere causes the oceans to become acidic.

H1.text: Ocean vaporization occurs when excess carbon dioxide in the atmosphere causes the oceans to become acidic.

H2.text: Acid rain occurs when excess carbon dioxide in the atmosphere causes the oceans to become acidic.

H3.text: Desalinization occurs when excess carbon dioxide in the atmosphere causes the oceans to become acidic.

A4.text: Between 1950 and 2020, the average pH of the ocean surface fell from approximately 8.15 to 8.05.

A5.text: Carbon dioxide emissions from human activities are the primary cause of ocean acidification, with atmospheric carbon dioxide (CO2) levels exceeding 422 ppm (as of 2024).
